column3: and capital city of Sakon Nakhon Province as well as Mueang Sakon Nakhon District

column3: and a base for Communist activities in the late 1950s.

column1: Sakon Nakhon lies on a flat plain at about 175 metres (574 ft) elevation on the south-west bank of Lake Nong Han
column2: the largest lake of north-east Thailand. The town is surrounded by extensive farmland.

column1: Sakon Nakhon has a tropical savanna climate (Köppen climate classification Aw). Winters are dry and very warm. Temperatures rise until April
column2: which is hot with the average daily maximum at 35.1 °C (95.2 °F). The monsoon season runs from May through October
column3: with heavy rain and somewhat cooler temperatures during the day
column4: although nights remain warm. The lowest temperature ever recorded in Thailand is in Sakon Nakhon when −1.4 °C (29.5 °F) was recorded on 2 January 1974.
